required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of the Combination Therapy of T-614 and Methotrexate in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients With an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of the Combination Therapy of T-614 and Methotrexate in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients With an Inadequate Response to Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of T-614 versus placebo when added to ongoing, stable-dose methotrexate therapy in patients with persistently active rheumatoid arthritis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of American College of Rheumatology [ACR] 20 Criteria Responders
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
primary_outcome.description: ACR20 response is defined as at least a 20% improvement in tender joint count and swollen joint count, and in three of five of the following measures: patient pain intensity assessment, patient global assessment, physician global assessment, Health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI), and an acute phase reactant [erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP)].

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Tender Joint Counts and Swollen Joint Counts
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of individual ACR core components like Tender Joint Counts (TJC) and Swollen Joint Counts (SJC)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in PAP, PtGADA and PyGADA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient's assessment of pain (PAP), patient's global assessment of disease activity (PtGADA) and physician's global assessment of disease activity (PyGADA) each was assessed on a visual analog scale ranging from 0-100 mm, with higher scores indicating severe disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ-DI was a participant assessed measure of health assessment, measured on a single scale ranging from 0 (no difficulty) to 3 (unable to do), with higher scores indicating severe disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in C-reactive Protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of individual ACR core components i.e. CRP

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (ESR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of individual ACR core components i.e. ESR

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Activity Score in 28 Joints (DAS28): The Rates of Remission (DAS28-CRP Less Than 2.6), and Low Disease Activity (DAS28-CRP Less Than 3.2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 is a composite score derived from 4 of these measures i.e count of 28 swollen joints, 28 tender joints, measure erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C reactive protein (CRP) and to make a 'global assessment of health' (indicated by marking a 10 cm line between very good and very bad). DAS28 is assessed as score on scale from 0 to 10 indicating current rheumatoid arthritis (RA) disease activity (0= low disease activity and 10 = high disease activity).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: ACR50 response is defined as at least a 50% improvement in tender joint count and swollen joint count, and in three of five of the following measures: patient pain intensity assessment, patient global assessment, physician global assessment, Health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI), and an acute phase reactant [erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP)].

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 LOCF (for T-614 arm and placebo arm) and Week 52 LOCF (for T614 arm and placebo/T614 arm)
secondary_outcome.description: ACR70 response is defined as at least a 70% improvement in tender joint count and swollen joint count, and in three of five of the following measures: patient pain intensity assessment, patient global assessment, physician global assessment, Health assessment questionnaire disability index (HAQ-DI), and an acute phase reactant [erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C-reactive protein (CRP)].

intervention.description: T-614 is administered twice daily in combination with methotrexate. The daily dose of T-614 is 25 mg for the first 4 weeks and 50 mg for subsequent weeks.
Placebo is administered twice daily in combination with methotrexate. In placebo group, patients will receive T-614 after completing 28 weeks of treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Subjects who have a diagnosis of Rheumatoid Arthritis by the ACR criteria
- Age greater or 20 years and less than 70 years old
Exclusion criteria:
- Subject who is considered by the investigator, for any reason, to be an unsuitable candidate for the study
- Women of childbearing potential who are not practicing a successful method of contraception, or wish to become pregnant

overall_official.affiliation: JAC PCU. EPCS, Eisai Co., Ltd.

group.title: T-614 (Double-blind, 1-28 Weeks)
group.description: T-614 was administered in combination with methotrexate. Double blind phase-T-614 was orally administered at dosages of 25 mg/day for the first 4 weeks (25 mg once daily) and 50 mg/day (25 mg twice daily) for subsequent 24 weeks.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind, 1-28 Weeks)
group.description: Placebo was administered in combination with methotrexate. Placebo was administered orally at dosages of a tablet once daily for first 4 weeks and a tablet twice daily for subsequent 24 weeks in double-blind period.

group.title: T-614 (Extension, 29-52 Weeks)
group.description: T-614 was administered in combination with methotrexate. Extension phase- T-614 was orally administered at a dosage of 50 mg/day (25 mg twice daily) for subsequent 24 weeks.

group.title: Placebo/T-614 (Extension, 29-52 Weeks)
group.description: Participants entered from double-blind placebo phase to 24-week open-label extension phase to receive T-614. T-614 was orally administered at dosages of 25 mg/day for the first 4 weeks (25 mg once daily) and 50 mg/day for subsequent 20 weeks (25 mg twice daily).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Drug Refusal Due to Adverse Event
Drug Refusal Due to Adverse Event

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics are presented based on full analysis set, defined as all randomized patients who received at least one dose of study drug and from whom at least one assessment of efficacy under double-blind medication was available.

outcome.title: Disease Activity Score in 28 Joints (DAS28): The Rates of Remission (DAS28-CRP Less Than 2.6), and Low Disease Activity (DAS28-CRP Less Than 3.2)
outcome.description: The DAS28 is a composite score derived from 4 of these measures i.e count of 28 swollen joints, 28 tender joints, measure erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) or C reactive protein (CRP) and to make a 'global assessment of health' (indicated by marking a 10 cm line between very good and very bad). DAS28 is assessed as score on scale from 0 to 10 indicating current rheumatoid arthritis (RA) disease activity (0= low disease activity and 10 = high disease activity).

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 1 - 52 weeks for T614 (double-blind and extension) arm, up to 1 - 24 weeks for placebo (double-blind) arm and Up to 29 - 52 Weeks for placebo/T614 (extension) arm.
reported_events.desc: Treatment emergent adverse events are presented in this section.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
